bug.short_desc: Position the tooltip balloon connector properly

long_desc.thetext: Sometimes the validation tooltips appear to the left and sometimes to the right of the field. But the connector always appear to the left of the balloon. Either reposition the connector or always place the tooltip to the right. Also ensure the proper Y coordinate so the connector actually connects to the related field.

Added the theming and also new states to decide if a popup has been placed to the left or right of the original widget.
master: 3817ef7620396f983a7fdba5db151e5c72f610b4

(In reply to comment #2) > Added the theming and also new states to decide if a popup has been placed to > the left or right of the original widget. > > master: 3817ef7620396f983a7fdba5db151e5c72f610b4
The following commit 5a18843faa103416cda50b689d7a974780e29009 has broken shadow handling for the aristo theme (left and top shadow missing and focus frames around fields do not show up).
See attached screenshots.
Created attachment 1145 Screenshot showing shadows and focus before commit 5a18843faa103416cda50b689d7a974780e29009
Created attachment 1146 Screenshot showing shadow and focus after commit 5a18843faa103416cda50b689d7a974780e29009
Thanks for that. Is the red border missing in total? Could you maybe also attach your app you used for testing?

(In reply to comment #6) > Thanks for that. Is the red border missing in total? Yes. The red border is missing completely.
> Could you maybe also attach your app you used for testing? I've to isolate something out of my testapp. I'm busy with other things today and tomorrow. I'll try to create a testcase on wednesday.

(In reply to comment #6) > Could you maybe also attach your app you used for testing? I don't need to create a testcase. To reproduce just use the demo from the Aristo-theme (in qooxdoo-contrib) and run the "Form" showcase.
The bug is visible if a field gains focus, which should show a blue border around the focused field. Additionally the left and top shadow disappears. The right, bottom shadows show up wider.
No, not jet but got it on my todo list for this week.
*** Bug 5656 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Enabled the shadow inset handling again. Finally, I understand the problem which I had in the first place. Having the error tool tip as shared instance cause a change in the shadow decorator from "arrow-right" to "arrow-left" in case the popup does not fit to the right side of the widget. The changing shadow element caused the insets to change and due to the wrong calculation to use the wrong insets. Well, it added the insets but did not substract the former insets from the current bounds of the element wich are the original width plus the insets. Doing so fixed the issue!
master: 313546af70da0fb8743784ccc5ea8c7d0571eb49

I repen this bug, because the issue still exists. You can reproduce this issue with the demo browser app ui.FormInValids. Open the app and switch to the modern theme. Move the mous to all elements to reproduce the issue.

In the end, it was in the widget code which applied the shadow element the first time with negative insets. As soon as the content changed its size, the resize of the BackgroundDecorator took charge and applied positive insets. As this is only valid for the shadow element, i decided to change the code in the widget to fix the issue and have shadow and decorator treated the same way.
master: 49167cfc39b6fc421bbca2b651956d35e40d13ce 2.0.x: 014643505658216a1932e8bbf29424285584c283

The error tooltip arrows on IE8 with modern theme (non CSS shadow browsers?) are misplaced.
I've attached two screenshots showing the bug.
Created attachment 1174 Widget browser with modern theme on IE8 with an error tooltip left to the widget
Created attachment 1175 Widget browser with modern theme on IE8 with an error tooltip right to the widget

Fixed the appearance for IE8. But had to take a away the right arrow. We are using the alphy image loader to load the arrow which means, that IE treats the images not as background image. This has the consequence that the background position does not work which means, we can not move the arrow to the right border of the element. There would be a workaround to create a separate div and place that but thats way too much work for old IEs. It sill looks ok without the arrow in IE < 9.
